author: Subodh Varma
description: In its 'Make India Water Positive' initiative, the Times of India addresses wastage and mismanagement of water.
title: India uses up more groundwater than US and China - Times of India

description: "Continued threat of high level terror attacks in India, violence in Kashmir and bilateral diplomatic recriminations will further strain India-Pakistan ties in 2017," a top American defence intelligence chief has told lawmakers.
title: India considering punitive actions against Pakistan: US official - Times of India

description: It is not worth spending more government funds on Air India’s revival
title: Maharajah of debt: On Air India’s revival

description: India begins the heavy-lifting needed to transform economic partnerships in Africa
title: Continental ties - India's outreach to Africa

author: ESPNcricinfo staff
description: Half-centuries from Mithali Raj and Punam Raut helped India women make light work of a 157 chase in the final against South Africa
title: Goswami, Raj star in India's title win

author: Stephen Leahy
description: While President Trump wants to revive America’s coal industry, India is embracing renewables, LED lighting, electric cars, and more.
title: India Launches Massive Push for Clean Power, Lighting, and Cars

author: Rajat Pandit
description: Both India and Pakistan continue to maintain high operational military readiness along the volatile Line of Control (loC), with daily cross-border firing duels becoming the norm.
title: India, Pakistan maintain high operational military readiness along LoC - Times of India

author: Indrani Bagchi
description: By doing foreign policy differently — as the Modi government completes its third year in office — India has challenged conventional thinking. Shunning its tradition of avoiding confrontation with China publicly, India protested OBOR, CPEC. Announcement of surgical strike in Pakistan is also a bold decision.
title: Three years of Modi government: Foreign policy takes an unconventional route - Times of India

description: India destroys Pak posts with heavy artillery for aiding infiltration.The Army "very recently" destroyed Pakistani military posts in Rajouri with punitive artillery assaults, to give "a befitting reply to the Pakistan military which aids infiltration into the Indian side" in Jammu and Kashmir.
title: India destroys Pak posts with heavy artillery for aiding infiltration | News- Times of India Videos

author: Surendra Singh
description: India is still behind many Asian countries when it comes to internet speed. But things are set to change in the next 18 months when Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) plans to usher in an age of high-speed internet in the country with the launch of three communication satellites.
title: India to enter high-speed internet era with Isro's new satellites - Times of India
